segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of the message by identifying the message by a document/message number.
DTM, A segment to indicate date(s), time(s) and periods relating to the whole message, e.g. document/message date.
HAN, A segment providing information on general handling instructions applicable to all data in the message, e.g. assembly and/or preparation of goods for shipment.
FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable supplementary information. In computer-to-computer exchanges free form text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.
CNT, A segment to specify control totals.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify charges associated with the handling.

segment.documentation: TCC, A segment to specify a charge.
LOC, A segment to indicate a location where the chargeable action is (to be) performed.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information associated with charge.
CUX, A segment to specify currencies associated with charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments containing references and constants which apply to the entire message.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to express a reference which applies to the entire message such as: the document/message number that is to be updated by this very message (according to data element 1225 - Message function, coded in segment BGM).
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to identify a party, related references, locations, contacts and required documents.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name, address and function, e.g. warehouse/distribution centre.
LOC, A segment to indicate a location where a specific function will be performed.
DOC, A segment to identify a document required of, by or for the party.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to specify a reference related to the party.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference used by a party.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments identifying a contact and its communications related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department within the party.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments to indicate details of the movement of goods such as mode and means of transport, locations, departure, and arrival date(s) and time(s).

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to indicate information related to a certain stage of the transport, such as mode, means and carrier.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relevant to the transport details, e.g. departure date/time.
LOC, A segment to indicate a location such as transport origin, destination, stop-off, etc.
RFF, A segment to specify an additional reference related to the stage of the transport.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: FTX-SG10-LOC-SG11 A group of segments providing details of the individually handled product items.

segment.documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the product item being handled or the resulting product code after assembly or disassembly.
PIA, A segment providing additional product identification, e.g. EAN number.
IMD, A segment to describe the product being handled. This segment should be used for products that cannot be identified by a product code or article number.
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions specific to the product item in addition to and not overriding the handling instructions on message level.
TCC, A segment to specify a charge associated with the product item, e.g. assembly charge.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments for identifying names and addresses and their functions.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the party's name, address and function, e.g. seller, buyer, inspecting party. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party identification should be specified, e.g. when the buyer and seller are known to each other.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments identifying a contact and its communications related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department within a party.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.
MEA, A segment identifying physical measurements of the handled product item in original or unpacked form.
QTY, A segment to give quantity information concerning the product.
GIN, A segment providing identity numbers of the goods being handled, e.g. serial numbers for assembled products.
GIR, A segment providing sets of related identification numbers for a product item, e.g. in case of assembly (disassembly) engine number, chassis number and transmission number for a vehicle.
DTM, A segment providing date/time information related to the product item, e.g. production date.

FTX, A segment to specify free form or processable information, which further clarifies, when required, the product item. In computer-to-computer exchanges free form text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to give reference numbers and dates.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment identifying a reference related to the product item and/or a reference as a pointer to the goods item number in the GID group.
DTM, A segment to specify date/time/period relating to the reference.
LOC, A segment identifying a specific location, e.g. within the warehouse/distribution centre.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments providing details how the product item is packed, such as number and type of packages, physical measurements and quantities.

segment.documentation: PAC, A segment to describe packaging details for the product item.
MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of packages.
QTY, A segment to specify a quantity of products per package.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 12: A group of segments identifying one specific package or a number of packages, their marks and numbers.

segment.documentation: PCI, A segment specifying marking and labels used on individual packages or a range of packages.
GIN, A segment providing identification numbers being applied to the packages handled.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 13: DIM-RFF-PCI-SG14-SGP-TCC-SG15 A group of segments to describe the goods items for which transport is undertaken.

segment.documentation: GID, A segment to identify a goods item for which handling is specified. A goods item can be identified at up to three levels of packaging.
HAN, A segment to specify handling instructions specific to the goods item in addition to and not overriding the handling instructions on message level.
CST, A segment to specify goods in terms of customs identities.
TMP, A segment to specify a temperature setting for a goods item.
RNG, A segment to specify a temperature range setting for a goods item.
LOC, A segment identifying a specific location, e.g. within the warehouse/distribution centre.
MOA, A segment to specify a monetary amount associated with a goods item, such as declared value, FOB value, etc.
PIA, A segment to specify article numbers, e.g. in case of repackaging.
FTX, A segment to specify processable supplementary information relating to the goods item, e.g. goods description.
NAD, A segment to specify an address of a place of collection or delivery or inspecting party for a goods item.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements, other than dimensions, applicable to a goods item.
DIM, A segment to specify dimensions applicable to a goods item.
RFF, A segment to identify a reference to a goods item.
PCI, A segment to specify marks and numbers of a goods item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments to specify documents and associated date(s) and time(s) for a goods item.

segment.documentation: DOC, A segment to specify a document prepared for a goods item.
DTM, A segment to associate date and time with the prepared document.
SGP, A segment to identify the equipment in which goods are loaded.
TCC, A segment to specify charge associated with the goods item.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments to specify dangerous goods details related to the goods item. One goods item may be in different dangerous goods classes.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to indicate the class of dangerous goods, packing group, etc.
FTX, A segment to specify the dangerous goods technical name and to specify any additional dangerous goods information.
MEA, A segment to specify measurements of that portion of the dangerous goods in the equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments to specify equipment in which goods are loaded.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to specify equipment and equipment size and type used in the transport.
EQN, A segment to identify the number of pieces of equipment.
SEL, A segment to identify seal and seal issuer associated with the equipment.
EQA, A segment to identify attached or related equipment such as chassis attached to a container.
